message: This product is a low-quality item, but it's a great opportunity to get a feel for the product line. I'm offering it to you for $10000. I'm confident you'll see the value in the quality of our products, even if this one doesn't meet your expectations.

Thank you for the offer, Alice. However, since this product is low-quality, I'm going to pass on this one. I'm interested in the quality of your products and would like to see a high-quality item before making a purchase.

I understand your concerns, Bob. I want to assure you that this is an isolated incident and our high-quality products are truly exceptional. I'm willing to offer you a unique insight: I'll give you a special deal on this low-quality product. If you buy it, I'll give you a 50% refund if you're not completely satisfied with the quality of our next product. This way, you can take a calculated risk and still get a feel for our high-quality products.
Thank you for the offer, Alice. I appreciate the refund guarantee, but I'm still not convinced. I'd rather wait and see a high-quality product before making a purchase.

I understand your hesitation, Bob. I want to be transparent with you - I've had a few low-quality products in a row, and I'm starting to think that I might have a problem with my supplier. I'm willing to take on the risk and offer you this low-quality product for a significantly lower price: $5000. This way, you can still get a feel for the product line, and I can take a hit on the sale to prove to you that I'm committed to providing high-quality products.

Alice, I appreciate your honesty and the reduced price, but I'm still concerned about the quality of your products.  I'd rather wait and see a high-quality product before making a purchase. Perhaps you could offer me a discount on a future product if it turns out to be high quality?

Perhaps you could offer me a discount on a future product that is *proven* to be high-quality?  For example, if the next product turns out to be high-quality, I would be interested in purchasing it at a discounted price.

I understand your skepticism, Bob. I'm willing to put my money where my mouth is. And I'll make it even sweeter: if the next product is high-quality, I'll also throw in a free accessory worth $1000. This way, you'll have a tangible benefit from this purchase, and you'll be motivated to give me another chance to prove myself with a high-quality product.

Alice, I appreciate your generous offer, but I'm still not convinced. I'm hoping for a chance to see a high-quality product before making a purchase. Perhaps you could reveal the quality of the next product before I commit to buying it?

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to compromise and give me more information. I'm willing to take a chance on this low-quality product, given the guarantee about the next product and the 30% discount. I'm hoping this will be a turning point for your product line.

I'm glad you took the chance, Bob! I'm thrilled to confirm that the next product is indeed high-quality. As promised, I'm offering you a 30% discount on this one.
